info.title: Measuring Point
info.description:
Measuring points in the SAP System describe the physical and/or logical locations at which a condition is described, (for example, the coolant temperature in a nuclear power station after the coolant has left the pressure vessel, or the number of revolutions at a rotor shaft of a wind-driven power plant). The following events are raised for Measuring Point: 
 - Measuring Point Created 
 - Measuring Point Changed

CloudContext.title: Schema for the CloudEvents context fields.
CloudContext.description: This is a schema specification for the context fields as per CloudEvent standards.

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification which the event uses. This enables the interpretation of the context.

type.description: Type of occurrence which has happened. Often this property is used for routing, observability, policy enforcement, etc.

subject.description: The subject of the event in the context of the event producer (identified by source).

time.description: Timestamp of when the occurrence happened. Must adhere to RFC 3339.

post.description: This event is raised whenever a new measuring point is updated (or activated or deactivated) from OData API, SAPGUI (IK02) or from WebDynpro application (Change Measuring Point).
This event is raised whenever a new measuring point is created from OData API, SAPGUI (IK01) or from WebDynpro application (Create Measuring Point).
